channel.title: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
channel.description: The Moscow Times offers everything you need to know about Russia: Breaking news, top stories, business, analysis, opinion, multimedia, upcoming cultural events

item.title: Siberia Forest Fires Fueled by Historic Drought, Heatwave
item.description: More than 250 fires covering 607,000 hectares of land are currently burning across the republic of Sakha, Russia's largest region.

item.title: Georgia LGBTQ Activists Cancel Pride March After Clashes
item.description: Organizers accused the prime minister of encouraging homophobic sentiments and his government of failing to "protect fundamental human rights."

item.title: French Champagne Houses Cry Foul Over Russian Label Rule
item.description: President Vladimir Putin signed a law that will forbid the use of the Russian translation of champagne on imported bottles.

item.title: Vaccinate or Repent Forever, Russian Orthodox Church Warns
item.description: An independent poll released Monday said 54% of Russians are still unwilling to get vaccinated against Covid-19.

item.title: Russian Warships to Reinforce Black Sea Forces Amid U.S.-Led Drills
item.description: The vessels will join forces activated for training checks against the backdrop of NATO’s Sea Breeze drills.

item.title: Majority of Russians Still Not Ready for Covid-19 Vaccination – Poll
item.description: The Levada Center also said 58% of Russians do not support the policy of compulsory vaccination that's being ordered by a growing number of regions.

item.title: Oscar-Winning Director Vladimir Menshov Dies at Age 82
item.description: The Soviet director and actor passed away on Sunday at age 82 from coronavirus.

item.title: Russia Says Its Forests Neutralize Billions of Tons of Greenhouse Gases. Scientists Have Their Doubts.
item.description: Eight experts told The Moscow Times the government headline figure of 2.5 billion metric tons of CO2 is at best unproven and at worst unrealistic.

item.title: Russian Food Retailer VkusVill Apologizes for ‘Hurtful’ LGBT Family Ad
item.description: Members of Russia's LGBT community slammed the apology.

item.title: Khodorkovsky Says Ready to Relocate His Russia-Based Journalists Facing ‘Next Purge’
item.description: He made the announcement after Russia added four of his civil society and educational groups to its list of “undesirable” organizations.

item.title: News From Russia: What You Missed Over the Weekend
item.description: Delta spread. Champagne suspension. LGBT ad apology.

item.title: Coronavirus in Russia: The Latest News | July 5
item.description: Record-setting deaths. Moscow cases soar. Mandatory vaccination.

item.title: Russia Posts Highest Number of Virus Cases Since Early January
item.description: Russia on Sunday announced 25,142 new infections, the highest figure since January 2 when Russia was emerging from a second wave of the pandemic.

item.title: Russian Law Takes Fizz Out of French Champagne Supplies
item.description: Russian elites could soon find themselves without their favorite French bubbles if Moet Hennessy makes good on a threat to halt champagne supplies following a new law signed by President Vladimir Putin.

item.title: Former French PM Fillon Joins Russian Oil Company Board
item.description: Former French prime minister Francois Fillon has been named to the board of Russian state oil company Zarubezhneft, a list published by a website specialising in business information disclosure showed.

item.title: Russia Reports Record Covid Deaths for Fifth Straight Day
item.description: Russia is battling the surging Delta variant.

item.title: Arctic Ocean’s ‘Last Ice Area’ Disappearing Faster Than Expected – Study
item.description: The oldest, thickest Arctic sea ice known as the “Last Ice Area” is melting faster than anticipated as the earth warms, scientists wrote.

item.title: Russian Governors’ Approvals Drop as Kremlin Distances From Virus Response – Poll
item.description: Russia's regions have been tasked with taking unpopular measures like mandatory vaccinations during the latest Covid-19 surge.

item.title: Moscow Restaurants Struggle to Stay Afloat Under New Virus Restrictions
item.description: All the city's eateries now require diners to present QR codes showing vaccination, negative PCR tests or proof of recovery from Covid-19.

item.title: Russian Food Retailer Defies ‘Gay Propaganda’ Law With LGBT Family-Featuring Ad
item.description: “We believe not featuring the families of our real customers would be hypocritical,” VkusVill said.

item.title: Russia Rejects New Lockdown Despite Record Virus Deaths
item.description: Russia is battling a surging outbreak driven by the highly infectious Delta variant and worsened by a lagging vaccination drive.

item.title: Russia Points Finger Back at U.S. Over Latest Cyberattack Accusations
item.description: U.S. cybersecurity agencies blamed Kremlin-backed hackers for a series of attacks on Western private and government entities.

item.title: Russia Confirms 600 More Instructors Sent to C.Africa
item.description: Six hundred Russian security instructors have recently been sent to the Central African Republic, the foreign ministry said on Thursday.

item.title: Russia Summons Czech Envoy Over ‘Extortionist’ Arms Blast Claims
item.description: Prague requested compensation from Moscow over a deadly 2014 arms depot blast it blames on Russian military intelligence.

item.title: Finland Traces 40% of New Virus Cases to Football Fans Returning From Russia
item.description: Out of 4,500 Finnish fans who went to St. Petersburg, 386 are known to have tested positive, with another 50 directly linked cases.

item.title: Russia Says Foiled IS Attacks in Moscow, South
item.description: The FSB said that the attacker in Astrakhan was "neutralized with return fire," while the second attacker was detained in Moscow.

item.title: Russia Orders Foreign Tech Giants to Set Up Local Foothold
item.description: Internet companies that don't open an office in Russia could end up fully blocked within the country.

item.title: Russian Security Forces Unable to Get QR Codes to Dine Out in Moscow
item.description: The FSB and FSO are required by law to keep employees' personal data private, excluding them from public health databases.

item.title: Russia Imposes Biometric, Drug Screening for Foreigners
item.description: Foreigners coming to Russia for periods longer than three months will have to submit their fingerprints and other biometric data.

item.title: Skepticism to Acceptance: How Putin's Views on Climate Change Evolved Over the Years
item.description: Despite eventually accepting that climate change is a threat, Putin is still reluctant to support drastic economic changes recommended by the UN.

item.title: Russia Posts Record Covid Deaths for Third Day Running
item.description: The daily death toll of 672 released Thursday topped Wednesday's record of 669 and Tuesday's of 652.

item.title: Russia Races Tom Cruise and Musk for First Movie in Space
item.description: One of Russia's most celebrated actresses, Yulia Peresild, is blasting off to the ISS with film director Klim Shipenko in October.

item.title: Russia Tags 4 Khodorkovsky-Linked NGOs ‘Undesirable’
item.description: Another “undesirable” Khodorkovsky group, Open Russia, disbanded in May to avoid jail sentences for supporters.

item.title: Putin's Phone-In Hit by 'Cyberattacks'
item.description: This year's phone-in repeatedly faced connection problems, particularly during calls from remote regions.

item.title: Putin Says Ukraine Is Controlled by Western Leaders
item.description: An adviser to Ukrainian President Zelenskiy's chief of staff dismissed Putin's claims as a "basic element of Russian propaganda."

item.title: Russia Hands Out Longest Jail Terms Yet to Jehovah’s Witnesses
item.description: Two members of the religious denomination labeled “extremist” in 2017 have been sentenced to seven and eight years.

item.title: Putin Reveals He Took Russia’s Sputnik V Coronavirus Vaccine
item.description: The Kremlin previously said it would keep the name of the Russian-made vaccine that Putin received this spring a “secret.”

item.title: Putin Takes Russians' Questions at Annual Marathon Call-In
item.description: This year’s event focused heavily domestic issues including Covid-19 vaccination efforts and rising food prices.

item.title: Russia Launches Cargo Ship to Space Station
item.description: Russian space freighter is scheduled to dock with the International Space Station on Friday, bringing 420 liters of water and other supplies to Earth's orbit.

item.title: Guatemala Seeks Refund from Russia Over Delayed Vaccine Doses – Reports
item.description: The Latin American country has only received 150,000 Sputnik V doses out of the 8 million it purchased.

item.title: Russia Wields S-400 Missile Systems in Response to U.S.-Led Black Sea Drills
item.description: Ukraine and 32 NATO members are carrying out the Sea Breeze 2021 drills involving 5,000 military personnel, 40 aircraft and 32 warships.

item.title: Russia Approves Roster of Neutral Athletes for Tokyo 2020
item.description: Russia is banned from international competitions for two years over doping violations.

item.title: U.S., Russia at Odds as UN Council Confronts Threat of Cyberattacks
item.description: The U.S. envoy asked that member states respect a cybersecurity framework already in place, while her Russian counterpart called for a new treaty.

item.title: Dutch Say Russian Jets Buzzed Warship in Black Sea
item.description: The incident last Thursday involved the frigate HNMLS Evertsen.

item.title: Germany Bans Travel From Russia, Citing Coronavirus Variant Spread
item.description: The announcement came as Russia grapples with a third wave fueled by the highly contagious Delta variant and slow vaccination uptake.

item.title: Russia Confirms First Delta Plus Variant Cases
item.description: Delta Plus is a variant of the highly contagious Delta variant first detected in India that accounts for 90% of Moscow’s new Covid-19 cases.

item.title: Demand Finally Outstrips Supply in Russia’s Vaccination Race
item.description: As mandatory vaccination programs kick-start a sluggish jab campaign, the country’s regions are facing shortages.

item.title: Russia Won't Hit 60% Vaccination Target By Autumn, Kremlin Says as Virus Surges
item.description: Russia's goal of reaching herd immunity through vaccination has been delayed by a lagging public uptake.

item.title: Moscow's QR Code System for Restaurant Access, Explained
item.description: Many Muscovites have expressed confusion with the city's new rules requiring restaurant patrons to show proof of vaccination or immunity.

item.title: Russia Breaks Daily Coronavirus Fatality Record
item.description: Tuesday's record beats the previous mortality record set at the height of Russia’s second wave on Dec. 24.
